SEARCH
Package project332

Class Admin

java.lang.Object
project332.Person
project332.Admin
public class Admin extends Person
Represents an admin responsible for managing a library. Admin class extends Person. Admins can add, update, delete, and view resources in the library, view user logs, and configure library settings. Admins also manage users and oversee library operations. Admins can modify rules related to borrowing books, reserving meeting rooms, and using electronic resources for the faculty associated with their managed library.

      phoneNb - the phone number of the admin
      emailAddress - the email address of the admin
      schedule - the admin's working schedule
      managedLibrary - the library managed by this admin

    • updateBook

      public boolean updateBook(String isbn, String newTitle, String newAuthor, String newGenre, String newDescription)
      Updates the details of a book in the managed library's collection.
      Parameters:
      isbn - the ISBN of the book to update
      newTitle - the new title of the book (if null, title remains unchanged)
      newAuthor - the new author of the book (if null, author remains unchanged)
      newGenre - the new genre of the book (if null, genre remains unchanged)
      newDescription - the new description of the book (if null, description remains unchanged)
      Returns:
      true if the book was updated successfully, false otherwise

      Returns:
      true if the book was deleted successfully, false otherwise

    • viewFrequentBorrowers

      public void viewFrequentBorrowers()
      Retrieves a list of the most frequent borrowers from the managed library's faculty. The list is sorted in descending order of borrow count.

    • viewFrequentBooks

      public void viewFrequentBooks()
      Retrieves a list of the most borrowed books in the managed library. The list is sorted in descending order of borrow count.

    • generateOverdueBooksReport

      public void generateOverdueBooksReport(Faculty faculty)
      Generates a report of overdue books in the library system. This method iterates through the users in the faculty, checks each user's borrowed books, and identifies which books are overdue. It prints a report listing all overdue books.
      Parameters:
      faculty - The faculty whose users will be checked for overdue books.

    • setBorrowDuration

      public void setBorrowDuration(String userType, int duration)
      Configures borrowing duration for a specific user type.
      Parameters:
      userType - the type of user (e.g., "Student", "Professor")
      duration - the maximum borrowing duration in days
